title: Program Coordinator Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is; First interview: Phone interview Second interview: Virtual interview with a panel and give a presentation (one hour and thirty minutes) Third interview: Shadow in the office
Interview Questions: Situation based questions asked by panel.

title: Communication Dispatch Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Morehouse College (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview I had for this position was smooth and professional. It was not a uptight, uncomfortable type of interview. Everything was smiling and they even laughed. first, I had three employees interviewing me all at the same time. everyone asked a fair question about myself. Thank you Morehouse College for a being professional and making me feel like I am apart of this wonderful journey..
Interview Questions:
1. Tell us about yourself?
2. Tell us about your previous employer, and why did you leave?
3. How did/do you handle stress?
4. Can you multi-task?
5. How do you handle multi-tasking

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Morehouse College (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with the director of enrollment, easy interview. He made it comfortable and I was relaxed and was able to give all the information I wanted and he asked for.
Interview Questions: Was I able to be on time?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Morehouse College (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: They validate parking.  The only bad thing I can say about the interview is that interviews were scheduled back to back.  It was uncomfortable seeing the applicant interviewed before/after you.  Outside of that, wonderful interviewers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.  Why do you want to leave your current job?  This was a typical interview.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Morehouse College
Interview Descriptions: Traditional.  Definitely must know someone in organization.

title: Administrative Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Morehouse College (Atlanta, GA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: My qualifications and what I could offer were discussed.  Salary was discussed. Start date was discussed.  I had encountered my potential employer many times prior to discussing the possibility of working with her program.  I let her know how eager I was to work with her.  After much encouragement and meeting with her, she advised she had a position that she felt I was qualified.  Colleges run on budgets and job requisitions so it took time for the program to see if they could provide a competitive salary and that it fit into the budget.  In June of 2013, I was offered a position and I accepted.
Interview Questions: How do I feel about working with teens?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Morehouse College (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Not to long but they ask a lot of questions that don't pertain to your role. There was multiple people waiting to interview all in the hall. We converse with each other while waiting.
Interview Questions: How long would like to be employed with Morehouse.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Morehouse College (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Questions: What's would you say your friends would say is your greatest weakness?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Morehouse College (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was a temp when I was first hired at Morehouse.  The position ended up being permanent.  I was called for an interview for the position and eventually was offered the job.

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Morehouse College (Atlanta, GA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: the interview process went well. The representative who conducted my interview reviewed my resume and asked questions about my background. As the interview was conducted, the employer asked me more questions about past work experience and what have been the pros and the cons about my work experience.
Interview Questions: Q: What contributions could I make to being an influence in the youth's lives?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Morehouse College (Atlanta, GA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Haphazard, last minute call for a position, test on the spot not previously communicated, interview seemed unrelated to position considering it was a short contract, more focus on the test than on the interview process itself
Interview Questions: Performing tasks on computer that were not require dog the position

title: Prospect Researcher Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Morehouse College (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions:
A series of position related questions- offered by 2 individuals.   I was asked about my fundraising experience and how I would go about communicating and catering to potential donors.  I was asked if I had specific software experience in razors edge.  I am an out-of state applicant, so I was also asked about my ability to move quickly.

 Lasted about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: How would you cater to a potential donor?
